clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of UI05MSP015CT in Functional Dyspepsia
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-center, Randomized, Active-Controlled, Double-Blind, Non-Inferiority, Phase 3 Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of UI05MSP015CT in Functional Dyspepsia (MARS Study)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a multi-center, randomized, active-controlled, double-blind, non-inferiority, phase III clinical trial evaluating efficacy and safety of once-daily mosapride (UI05MSP015CT) in patients with functional dyspepsia.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients with functional dyspepsia were randomly assigned (1:1) to receive either UI05MSP015CT (15 mg once daily before breakfast, study group) or mosapride (5 mg three times a day before each meal, control group) and corresponding placebo t.i.d. or q.d. for 4 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of symptom score of functional dyspepsia
primary_outcome.description: Change of symptom score of functional dyspepsia was evaluated by symptom-specific questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of symptom score of functional dyspepsia
secondary_outcome.description: Change of symptom score of functional dyspepsia was evaluated by symptom-specific questionnaire.
Selecting: 'loss of symptom', 'apparent improvement', 'moderate improvement', 'no change', and 'deterioration'.
25 questions on five quality of life areas

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age >19 years
2. Diagnosis of functional dyspepsia meeting Rome III criteria
3. At least three moderate or severe symptoms included in the Symptom Score
4. No structural lesions of upper gastrointestinal tract
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of dyspepsia unrelated to functional dyspepsia or diseases
2. History of gastrointestinal surgery
3. History of malignancy in the previous 5 years
4. Psychiatric disorders including major depressive disorder and anxiety
5. Liver cirrhosis or abnormal liver laboratory findings
6. Advanced chronic kidney disease
7. Uncontrolled hypertension
8. Uncontrolled diabetes
9. Pregnancy and lactation
10. Recent history of taking medication affecting the gastrointestinal system
